content: Investments FSMOne Fundsupermart Asked by Gabriel ChooAsked 3w agoIs it true that a fund's management fee is included in the expense ratio?A fund with an annual management fee of 1.25% and annual expense ratio of 1.39%? If it's included in the expense ratio, what about fees for a mother fund?1 answerAnswerBump0
Answers (1)Sort By Most UpvoteMost UpvoteMost Recent

Elijah Lee, Independent Financial Advisor at Phillip Securities (Jurong East Lite)Top Contributor (Sep)Level 9. God of WisdomAnswered 3w agoHi, the management fee is part of the total expense ratio. For mother funds, they have their own layer of fees, however, for most fund houses, there is usually an internal arrangement that limits or even remove the fees arising from a fund feeding into a mother fund.1 comment2
Gabriel Choo3w agoThanks for the clarification Elijah!
